title: PHPis_null()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_null()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Check whether a variable is NULL or not: "; $b = null; echo "b is " . is_null($b) . "
"; $c = "null"; echo "c is " . is_null($c) . "
"; $d = NULL; echo "d is " . is_null($d) . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The is_null() function checks whether a variable is NULL or not. This function returns true (1) if the variable is NULL, otherwise it returns false/nothing. Syntax is_null( variable ); Parameter Values Parameter Description variable Required. Specifies the variable to check Technical Details Return Value: TRUE if variable is NULL, FALSE otherwise Return Type: Boolean PHP Version: 4.0.4+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:

"; $c = "null"; echo "c is " . is_null($c) . "
"; $d = NULL; echo "d is " . is_null($d) . "
"; ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPis_null()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPis_null()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPis_null()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
